title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 12 - Order to appear at violation of probation hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 12 - Order to appear at violation of probation hearing

State Regulations

Sec. 410.40 C.P.L. FORM 12
(Order to Appear at

Violation of

Probation Hearing)
1/87
NOTICE TO DEFENDANT
YOUR FAILURE TO APPEAR AT THE TIME AND PLACE
SPECIFIED BELOW WITHOUT REASONABLE CAUSE THEREFOR WILL CONSTITUTE A VIOLATION
OF THE CONDITIONS OF YOUR SENTENCE AND MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT
FOR YOUR ARREST. YOU HAVE A RIGHT TO BE PRESENT AT ANY HEARING TO DETERMINE
WHETHER A VIOLATION OF PROBATION HAS OCCURRED. IF YOU INTENTIONALLY ABSENT
YOURSELF FROM THE COURT'S JURISDICTION OR INTENTIONALLY FAIL TO APPEAR AT A
VIOLATION OF PROBATION HEARING, A HEARING MAY BE HELD IN YOUR ABSENCE AND A
REVOCATION OF YOUR PROBATION MAY RESULT. ________ COURT OF ________
COUNTY OF ________
________ x
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, - against - Indictment/Docket

No. ________
________, ORDER TO APPEAR AT
Defendant. VIOLATION OF PROBATION
HEARING
________ x
TO THE ABOVE-NAMED DEFENDANT: PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that this Court, having
reasonable cause to believe that you violated a condition of the sentence
imposed on you on ________, 19________, and having filed a written Declaration
of Delinquency on ________, 19 ________, it is hereby
ORDERED that you appear before this Court in
(Part) (Room)[FN1]________, located at ________, on ________, 19________, at
9:30 a.m., for the purpose of enabling this Court to make a final determination
with respect to the alleged delinquency. You are entitled to counsel at all stages of
any proceeding herein. You have the right to bring witnesses and present
evidence on your behalf and to cross-examine witnesses. You may request a
reasonable adjournment to prepare for your hearing. E N T E R
Dated: ________, 19________
________, New York
______________
Judge (Justice)
[FN1] Strike words in parentheses, as
appropriate. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form
12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
